channel.title: Java Bytecode Libraries
channel.description:
Im sorry for being extremely nooby when I ask this but anyway, what exactly are java bytecode libraries and what do they do as many people using to make new bots, like Ollies... I was just wondering because I am extremely interested in it although I don't actually want to use it in a way which has anything to do with runescape. Also, has anyone got any tutorials on it. I have also searched google for this but as I don't really know what to look for, I found nothing of interest. Can anyone help me please? Thanks :D
By the way... I'm not really too nooby at java in general, I just am at this...

item.title: Java Bytecode Libraries
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

Thanks. After you saying that, I think I may just try BCEL then…

Read full topic

item.title: Java Bytecode Libraries
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

ASM is basically designed for generating classes…it’s small and fast, very good at what it does. Not so good at editing previously existing stuff.
BCEL is the most powerful for editing classes, but it’s more complicated than javassist.
Javassist is the simplest to understand I think, but it can’t do as much as BCEL.
SERP is easy but slow, and iirc it’s only got a visitor mode. BCEL is more flexible there.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Bytecode Libraries
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Nope, its a another bytecode library written in java…I was wondering whether you were confused before (I was as well first time I heard people talking about it). http://asm.objectweb.org/

Read full topic

item.title: Java Bytecode Libraries
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

So, we’re talking about this… asm. Not assembly? Assembly has nothing to do with Java bytecode. It’s the closest you’ll get to machine code.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Bytecode Libraries
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I haven’t played much with asm, but I’ve heard its a nice (and very small) bytecode library…javaassist is really cool because you can even insert java code into pre-compiled classes. Besides bcel, asm, and javaassist though, there’s serp (http://serp.sourceforge.net/) and JMangler (http://roots.iai.uni-bonn.de/research/jmangler/).

I still recommend bcel as its probably one of the simplest to pick up.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Bytecode Libraries
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/ibm/library/it-haggar_bytecode/

Bytecode libraries basically allow you to manipulate the raw bytecode data of a compiled class. In regards to rs cheating, bytecode manipulation is and has been mainly used by deobfuscators to provide compile-able source code. It’s possible, though, to build a bot through bytecode, but normally method overloading is used instead.

As for learning, BCEL is always good to start with, and they have a decent guide on their site: http://jakarta.apache.org/bcel/index.html

Read full topic
